qas.question: The Grand Lodge of England is also know as what?
When was the Grand Lodge of England founded?
The Ancient Grand Lodge of England was formed on what date?
The United Grand Lodge of England was formed on what date?
Lodges that could not endorse the GLE were later called what?
What can The Grand Lodge of England never be known as?
When did the Grand Lodge of England vanish?
What were lodges that disappeared called?
Which lodges refused to join the new regulatory body?
Which lodges were always in perfect harmony with one another?

context: The first Grand Lodge, the Grand Lodge of London and Westminster (later called the Grand Lodge of England (<a0_0><b5_0>GLE<b5_0/><a0_0/>)), was founded on <a1_0><b6_0>24 June 1717<b6_0/><a1_0/>, when four existing London Lodges met for a joint dinner. <b8_0>Many English Lodges<b8_0/> joined the new regulatory body, which itself entered a period of self-publicity and expansion. However, many Lodges could not endorse changes which some Lodges of the GLE made to the ritual (they came to be known as <a4_0><b7_0>the Moderns<b7_0/><a4_0/>), and a few of these formed a rival Grand Lodge on <a2_0>17 July 1751<a2_0/>, which they called the "Antient Grand Lodge of England." These two <b9_0>Grand Lodges<b9_0/> vied for supremacy until the Moderns promised to return to the ancient ritual. They united on <a3_0>27 December 1813<a3_0/> to form the United Grand Lodge of England (UGLE).
